title: How I Outran the Covid Doldrums
sub_head: Many trained for races, but some took on extreme challenges.
body:
The temperature and humidity both neared triple digits as I loped around my in-lawsâ€™ suburban Houston neighborhood last summer. Despite the pain, or perhaps because of it, running made me feel alive.
A new running boom is under way. Run-tracking apps have become more popular, and YouTube channels dedicated to training have exploded in number. According to a survey from athletic-shoe-review company RunRepeat, nearly 29% of all runners world-wide started during the pandemic. I am one of them.
